turns.speaker: KINDERMAN
turns.text: Strange...strange...so baffling. The deceased comes to visit, stays only twenty minutes, and leaves all alone a very sick girl. And speaking plainly Mrs. MacNeil, as you say, it's not likely he would fall from a window. Besides that, a fall wouldn't do to his neck what we found except maybe a chance in a thousand. My hunch? My opinion? I believe he was killed by a very powerful man: point one. And the fracturing of the skull - point two - plus the various things I have mentioned, would make it very probable - probable, not certain - that the deceased was killed and then pushed from your daughter's window. But no-one was here except your daughter. So how could this be? It could be one way: if someone came calling between the time Miss Spencer left and the time you returned. The servants, they have visitors?

turns.speaker: KINDERMAN
turns.text: You were expecting a deliver y that day?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: I really wouldn't know, you see Karl takes care of that.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Would you like some more coffee?

turns.speaker: KINDERMAN
turns.text: Incidentally, just a chance in a million, I know; but your daughter - you could possibly ask her if she saw Mr. Dennings in her room that night?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Look, he wouldn't have any reason to be up there in the first place.

turns.speaker: KINDERMAN
turns.text: I know that. I realize. But if a certain British doctor never asked "What's this fungus?" we wouldn't today have penicillin. Correct?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: When she's well enough, I'll ask.

turns.speaker: KINDERMAN
turns.text: I hate to ask you this but... for my daughter could you maybe give an autograph?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Of course. Have you got a pen?

turns.speaker: KINDERMAN
turns.text: I lied. It's for me. The spelling is on the back, Kinderman. You know that film you made called Angel? Isaw that six times.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Good morning Karl. Oh Karl, we've got rats in the attic you better get some traps.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: All right then we've got clean rats.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Yeah or maybe rats now will you just get those traps.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Well don't go now Karl the stores aren't open yet.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Oh Karl, Jesus Christ Karl, don't do that.

turns.speaker: KARL
turns.text: Very sorry, but you see, no rats!

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: No rats. Thanks a lot that's terrific.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Karl? Did you put this in Regan's bedroom?

turns.speaker: KARL
turns.text: She is going to be well?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Karl if you put this in Regan's room I want you to tell me, now did you?

turns.speaker: KARL
turns.text: No. It wasn't me. I didn't.

turns.speaker: KARL
turns.text: Excuse me Madame? Will there be anything else?

turns.speaker: DR. KLEIN
turns.text: A disorder of the nerves. At least we think it is. We don't know yet exactly how it works, but it's often seen in earl adolescence. She shows all the symptoms: the hyperactivity; the temper; her performance in math.

turns.speaker: DR. KLEIN
turns.text: Now this is for Ritalin. Ten miligrams a day.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Stimulant? She's higher than a kite right now!

turns.speaker: DR. KLEIN
turns.text: Her condition isn't quite what it seems. Nobody knows the cause of her hyperkinetic behaviour in a child. The Ritalin sems to work to relieve the condition, but we really don't know how or why, frankly. Your daughter's symptoms could be an overreaction to depression- but that's out of my field.

turns.speaker: DR. KLEIN
turns.text: Well, you mentioned her father... the divorce.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Do you think I should take her to see a psychiatrist?

turns.speaker: DR. KLEIN
turns.text: Oh no. I'd wait and see what happens with the Ritalin. I think that's the answer. Wait two or three weeks.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: And those lies she's been telling?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Ya know, those things to get attention, like saying that her bed shakes and stuff.

turns.speaker: DR. KLEIN
turns.text: Have you ever known your daughter to swear and use obscenities?

turns.speaker: DR. KLEIN
turns.text: Well, you see, that's quite similar to things like her lying- uncharacter-

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Wait a minute. What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: DR. KLEIN
turns.text: Well, she let loose quite a string while I was examining her, Mrs. MacNeil.

turns.speaker: DR. KLEIN
turns.text: Well, I'd say her vocabulary's rather extensive.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Well, what, for example? I mean, give me a for instance!

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Hey, come on, I'm grown-up. What'd she say? I mean specifically, Doctor.

turns.speaker: DR. KLEIN
turns.text: Well, specifically, Mrs. MacNeil, she advised me to keep my fingers away from her goddam cunt.

turns.speaker: DR. KLEIN
turns.text: She used those words. Look, I doubt that she even understood what she was saying.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Yeah, I guess. Maybe not. You don't think a psychiatrist-?

turns.speaker: DR. KLEIN
turns.text: The best explanation is always the simplest one. Let's wait. Let's wait and see. In the meantime try not to worry.

turns.speaker: DR. KLEIN
turns.text: Well, It's a symptom of a type of desturbance in the chemico- electrical activity of the brain. In the case of your daughter in the temperal lobe, up here in the lateral part of the brain. It's rare, but it does cause bizarre hallucinations and usually just before a convulsion.

turns.speaker: DR. KLEIN
turns.text: The shaking of the bed, that's doubtless due to musuclar spasms.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Oh no, that was no spasm. I got on the bed, the whole bed was thumping and rising off the floor and shaking. The whole thing, with me on it!

turns.speaker: DR. KLEIN
turns.text: Mrs. MacNeil the problem with your daughter is not her bed, it's her brain.

turns.speaker: DR. KLEIN
turns.text: Lesion, Lesion in the temperal lobe. It's a kind of seizure disorder.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Look doc, I really don't understand how her whole personality could change.

turns.speaker: DR. KLEIN
turns.text: The temperal lobe is very common. Could last for days, even weeks. It isn't rare to find destructive or even criminal behaviour.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Hey do me a favour will ya'. Tell me something good.

turns.speaker: DR. KLEIN
turns.text: Don't be alarmed. If it's a lesion in a way she's fortunate. All we have to do is remove the scar.

turns.speaker: DR. KLEIN
turns.text: She's heavily sedated. She'll probably sleep through tomorrow.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: What was going on in there, how could she jump off the bed like that?

turns.speaker: DR. KLEIN
turns.text: We still think the temporal lobe...

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Oh. What are you talking about for Christ sake! Did you see her or not? She's acting like a fucking out of her mind psychotic or a split personality or...

turns.speaker: DR. KLEIN
turns.text: Do you keep any drugs in your house?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: No. Of course not, nothing like that.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Well of course I'm sure. I'd tell you. Christ, I don't even smoke grass.

turns.speaker: DR. KLEIN
turns.text: Are you planning to be home soon? LA, I mean.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: No. I'm building a new house, the old one's been sold. I was going to take Regan to Europe for a while, after she finished school here. Why d'you ask?

turns.speaker: DR. KLEIN
turns.text: I think it's time we started looking for a psychiatrist.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Oh, I'm very sorry Father. Hi.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: That's okay. I should've told you I wouldn't be in uniform.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Yeah, it would've helped. Have you gotta cigarette Father?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: So, how'd a shrink ever get to be a priest?

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: It's the other way around. The society sent me through med school.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: You're a friend of Father Dyer, right?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Did he tell you about my party?

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: No I didn't know you had one.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Didn't tell you of what she did?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Priests keep pretty tight mouthed then?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: I mean, what if a person, let's say, was a criminal, like maybe a murderer or something, you know? If he came to you for help, would you have to turn him in?

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: If he came to me for spritual help, I'd say no.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: No I wouldn't. But I'd try to persuade him to turn himself in.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: And how do you go about getting an exorcism?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: If a person was possessed by a demon of some kind, how do you go about getting an exorcism?

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: Well, the first thing I'd do is put them into a time macine and send them back to the sixteenth century.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: Well it just doesn't happen anymore Mrs. MacNeil.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: Since we learned about mental illness, paranoia, schizophrenia. All the things they taught me in Harvard. Mrs. MacNeil since the day I joined the Jesuits, I've never met one priest who has performed an exorcism, not one.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Yeah well, it just so happens that somebody very close to me is probably possessed, and needs an exorcist.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: That's all the more reason to forget about exorcism.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: To begin with it could make things worse.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: Well before the church approves an exorcism, it conducts an investigation to see if it's warranted. That takes time. In the meantime...

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: No I couldn't, I have to have church approval, and frankly, that's rarely given,-

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: Yes I could, I could see her as a psychiatrist...

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Not a psychiatrist! She needs a priest! She's already seen every fucking psychiatrist in the world and they sent me to you, now you're gonna send me back to them! Jesus Christ, won't somebody help her!

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: No, you don't understand. Your daughter-

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Oh, will you help her! Just help her!

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: Thanks. Look, I'm only against the possibility of doing your daughter more harm than good.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Nothing you could do would make it any worse.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: I can't do it. I need evidence that the church would accept as signs of possession.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: Like her speaking in a language that she's never known or studied.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: I don't know. I'll have to look it up.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: I thought you were supposed to be an expert.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: There are no experts. You probably know as much about possession than most priests. Look your daughter doesn't say she's a demon, she says she's the devil himself and if you've seen as many psychotics as I have, you'd know it's like saying you're Napoleon Bonaparte. You ask me what I think is best for your daughter. Six months, under observation in the best hospital you can find.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: You show me Regan's double: same face, same voice, same everything. I'd know it wasn't Regan. I'd know in my gut and I'm telling you that that thing upstairs isn't my daughter! And I want you to tell me that you know for a fact that there's nothing wrong with my daughter except in her mind! You tell me you know for a fact that an exorcism wouldn't do any good! You tell me that!

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: Did Regan know a priest was coming over?

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: Did you know my mother died recently?

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: No, is Regan aware of it?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Not at all. Why d'you ask?

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: No it's alright I'll take it straight.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: Have you told him what's happening?

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: I told Regan that was holy water, I sprinkled some on her and she reacted very violently. It's tap water.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: Holy water's blessed. And that doesn't help support a case for possession.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: She killed Burke Dennings. She pushed him out of the window.

turns.speaker: REGAN
turns.text: Well, me and Sharon played a game in the back yard, and we had a picnic down by the river.

turns.speaker: REGAN
turns.text: Oh mom, you should have seen this man came along on this beautiful grey horse.  Wasn't it pretty?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Really, what kind was it a mair or guilding?

turns.speaker: REGAN
turns.text: Think it was a guilding. It was grey. Oh it was so beautiful, the guy let me ride it all around.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Well, not while we're in Washington.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: We'll see when we get home okay.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: We'll see Regan.  Now about those party invitations.......

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Wait a minute you need two.

turns.speaker: REGAN
turns.text: No you don't. I do it all the time.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Oh yeah, well let's both play.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: You really don't want me to play huh?

turns.speaker: REGAN
turns.text: No I do, Captain Howdy said no.

turns.speaker: REGAN
turns.text: You know, I make the questions and he does the answers.

turns.speaker: REGAN
turns.text: Captain Howdy, Do you think my mom's pretty? Captain Howdy? Captain Howdy that isn't very nice.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Regan, why are you reading that?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: It's not even a good picture. Looks to mature.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Oh you wouldn't talk, well I didn't have my make up man there.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: What are we gonna do on your birthday, isn't that nice it's on a Sunday this year, what can we do?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Well what would you like to do? Got any ideas?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Okay. And tomorrow night, I'll take you to a movie, okay?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: I love you Rags. We'll have a good day yeah?

turns.speaker: REGAN
turns.text: You can bring Mr. Dennings if you like.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Well thank you very much but why on earth would I want to bring Burke on your birthday?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Yeah I like him. Don't you like him? Hey what's going on? What is this?

turns.speaker: REGAN
turns.text: Your not gonna marry him are you?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Oh my god, you kidding, me marry Burke Dennings don't be silly, of course not.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Where'd you ever get an idea like that?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Course I like him, I like pizzas to but I'm not gonna marry one.

turns.speaker: REGAN
turns.text: Do you not like him like daddy?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Oh Regan I love your daddy. I'll always love your daddy. Burke just comes around here a lot because he's lonely, don't got nothin' to do.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Oh you did. What did you hear?

turns.speaker: REGAN
turns.text: I don't know, I just thought.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Well your thinking's not so good.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Cause Burke and I are just friends. Okay, really.

turns.speaker: REGAN
turns.text: Why does God let us get tired?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: God gets lonesome for us, Rags. He wants us back.

turns.speaker: REGAN
turns.text: My bed was shaking, I can't get to sleep.

turns.speaker: REGAN
turns.text: Make it stop! What's wrong!! I'm scared!!!

turns.speaker: REGAN
turns.text: Mother please! Oh please mother make it stop! It's burning, it's burning please mother!

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: So something please Doctor, Help her!

turns.speaker: REGAN
turns.text: Make it stop,it really hurts! Mother! Make it...

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Over behind the church, you know where I mean over there, it's a red brick wing?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: What goes down there? I mean who's the priest I keep seeing, he's there all the time. He has black hair and he's very intense looking?

turns.speaker: FATHER DYER
turns.text: That's his office back of St. Mike's. He's our psychiatric counsellor. He had a pretty rough knock last night poor guy, his mother passed away. She was living by herself and I guess she was dead a couple of days before they found her.

turns.speaker: FATHER DYER
turns.text: Listen, I don't need any encouragement, but my idea of heaven is a solid white night club, with me as the head liner, for all eternity and they love me.

turns.speaker: DR. TANNEY
turns.text: Pathological states can induce abnormal strength, accelerated motor performance. For example, a ninety-pound women sees her child pinned under the wheel of a truck, runs out and lifts the wheels half a foot up off the ground. You know the story, same thing here. Same principle, I mean.

turns.speaker: DR. TANNEY
turns.text: There haven't been more than a hundred authenticated cases of so- called split personality, Mrs. MacNeil. Now I know the temptation is to leap to psychiatry, but any reasonable psychiatrist would exhaust the somatic possibilities first.

turns.speaker: DR. TANNEY
turns.text: A pneumoencephelogram, I would think, pin down that lesion. It will involve another spinal.

turns.speaker: DR. TANNEY
turns.text: What we missed in the EEG and the arteriogram could conceivably turn up there. At the least, it would eliminate certain other possibilities.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: Where'd you get the money for the Chivas Regal? The poor box?

turns.speaker: FATHER DYER
turns.text: That's an insult, I got a vow of poverty.

turns.speaker: FATHER DYER
turns.text: College president shouldn't drink. Tends to set a bad example, I figure I saved them from a big temptation.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: Oh Christ! I should of been there and I wasn't there, I should've been there.

turns.speaker: FATHER DYER
turns.text: There was nothing you could do. Lye down. C'mon.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: Are you gonna steal my shoes now?

turns.speaker: FATHER DYER
turns.text: No, I tell fortunes by reading the crease, now shut up and go to sleep.

turns.speaker: KINDERMAN
turns.text: Ah, that's good. That's all that's important. Back to business. Back to work. Bye now, Father.

turns.speaker: KINDERMAN
turns.text: I get passes. In fact I got a pass for The Crest tomorrow night. Would you like to go?

turns.speaker: KINDERMAN
turns.text: Heathcliff, Jackie Gleason, and in the role of Catherine Earnshaw, Lucille Ball.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: Hello Regan. I'm a friend of your mother, I'd like to help you.

turns.speaker: REGAN/DEMON
turns.text: You might loosen the straps then.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: I'm affraid you might hurt yourself Regan.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: I see. Well then let's introduce ourselves, I'm Damien Karras.

turns.speaker: REGAN/DEMON
turns.text: And I'm the Devil! Now kindly undo these straps!

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: If you're the devil, why not make the straps disappear?

turns.speaker: REGAN/DEMON
turns.text: That's much to vulgar a display of power Karras.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: Show me Regan and I'll loosen one of the straps.

turns.speaker: REGAN/DEMON
turns.text: Your mother's in here with us Karras, would you like to leave a message? I'll see that she gets it.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: If that's true, then you must know my mother's maiden name. What is it?

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: He broke the bread, gave it to his disciples and said "Take this, all of you and eat. For this is my body." When the supper had ended, he took the cup, again he gave you thanks and praise. Gave the cup to his disciples and said "Take this, all of you will drink from it, this is the cup of blood, the blood of the new and ever lasting covenant and the mystery of faith".

turns.speaker: REGAN/DEMON
turns.text: What an excellent day for an exorcism.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: But wouldn't that drive you out of Regan?

turns.speaker: REGAN/DEMON
turns.text: In time. But mirabile dictu, don't you agree?

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: How long are you planning to stay in Regan?

turns.speaker: REGAN/DEMON
turns.text: Until she rots and lie stinking in the earth.

turns.speaker: REGAN/DEMON
turns.text: Ydob eht ni mraw si ti! Uoy ees I! Tseirp a si eh! Emit su evig! Nirrem! Nirrem!

turns.speaker: REGAN/DEMON
turns.text: Tseirp a si eh! Eno on ma I! Eno on ma I! Ahhhhhhhhhhh!

turns.speaker: REGAN/DEMON
turns.text: I am no one! I am no one! He is a priest!

turns.speaker: REGAN/DEMON
turns.text: I am no one! I am no one! He is a priest!

turns.speaker: MRS.KARRAS
turns.text: Your Uncle John stopped by to visit me.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: Now momma you have to stay off it, you can't keep go up and down those stairs you have to give it rest.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: Momma I can take you somewhere to a place where you wouldn't be alone. There'd be people around, you know you won't have to sit here listening to the radio.

turns.speaker: MRS.KARRAS
turns.text: You are not happy. Tell me what is the matter?

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: Momma, I'm all right, I'm fine, really I am.

turns.speaker: MERRIN
turns.text: I would like you to go quickly over to the resdence Damien, and gather up a cassock for myself, two surplices, a purple stole, and some holy water, and your copy of The Roman Ritual. The Large one. I believe we should begin.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: Do you want to hear the background of the case, first?

turns.speaker: MERRIN
turns.text: We may ask what is relevant, but anything beyond that is dangerous. He is a liar, the demon is a liar. He will lie to confuse us. But he will also mix lies with the truth to attack us. The attack is psychological , Damien. And powerful. So don't listen, remember that, do not listen.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: I think it would be helpful if I gave you some background on the different personalities Regan has manifested. So far, there seems to be three. She's convinced-

turns.speaker: MERRIN
turns.text: Hallowed be thy name. Thy kingdom come, thy will be done, on earth as it is in heaven. Give us this day, our daily bread, and forgive us our trespasses, as we forgive those who trespass against us. And lead us not into temptation.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: But deliver us from the evil one.

turns.speaker: MERRIN
turns.text: Save me o' God by thy name, by thy might defend my cause, proud men have risen up against me, men of violence seek my life, but God is my helper, the Lord sustains my life and every need he has delivered to me, glory be to the Father, the Son and the Holy Spirit.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: As it was in the begin is now and ever shall be, world without end, amen.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: Who places her trust in thee, my God.

turns.speaker: MERRIN
turns.text: Be unto her o' Lord a fortified tower.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: In the face of the enemy.

turns.speaker: MERRIN
turns.text: Let the enemy have no power over her.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: And the son of iniquity be powerless to harm her.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: And let my cry come unto thee.

turns.speaker: MERRIN
turns.text: Let us pray. Holy Lord, almighty Father, everlasting God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who once and for all consigned that fallen tyrant to the flames of hell. Who sent your only begotten son into the world to crush that roaring lion.

turns.speaker: MERRIN
turns.text: ...and to redeem through your son. Who lives and reigns with you, in the unity of the holy spirit, God forever and ever.

turns.speaker: MERRIN
turns.text: Father Karras? Father Karras? Damien? The reponse please Damien!

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: And let my cry come unto thee.

turns.speaker: MERRIN
turns.text: ...and the power to confront this cruel demon.

turns.speaker: MERRIN
turns.text: See the cross of the Lord. Be gone you hostile power. O'Lord hear my prayer.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: And let my cry come unto thee.

turns.speaker: MERRIN
turns.text: ... upon this your servant, Regan Teresa MacNeil.

turns.speaker: KARRAS
turns.text: Why this girl it makes no sense?

turns.speaker: MERRIN
turns.text: I think the point is to make us dispair... To see our selves as... animal and ugly... To reject the possibillity that God could love us.
